sentence.Network_en: They often take a long time to die back after flowering.
sentence.Network_cn: 花期过后，它们的枝叶常常过很长一段时间才会枯萎。

sentence.Network_en: Flowering plants were making their first appearance, but were still a rarity.
sentence.Network_cn: 显花植物开始出现了，但仍然很少。

sentence.Network_en: Sadly, bamboo plants die after flowering.
sentence.Network_cn: 可惜的是，竹子开花后便会枯死。

entry.tran: (想法或艺术风格)成熟，风行，盛行
entry.def: The flowering of something such as an idea or artistic style is the development of its popularity and success.

example.ex: He may be happy with the flowering of new thinking, but he has yet to contribute much to it himself.
example.tran: 他也许会对新思想的盛行感到高兴，但他本人并没有为此作出多大贡献。

entry.def: Flowering shrubs, trees, or plants are those which produce noticeable flowers.

means.word_mean: 1. the time and process of budding and unfolding of blossoms

sentences.en: He planted a number of flowering shrubs in the garden.
sentences.cn: 他在花园里种了几丛开花的灌木。

sentences.en: The beautiful garden was edged with flowering trees.
sentences.cn: 那个美丽的花园四周围有开花的树木。

sentences.en: These shrubs will need more light to produce flowering shoots.
sentences.cn: 这些灌木需要更多的光照才能抽出开花的新枝。
